qas.question: What is generating high demand for housing in Melbourne?
What effect has the housing boom had on house prices and rents?
Which of Melbourne's suburbs have seen significant brownfields redevelopment in recent years?
What types of surburban development did Melbourne policies promote?

context: Melbourne is experiencing <a0_0>high population growth<a0_0/>, generating high demand for housing. This housing boom has <a1_0>increased<a1_0/> house prices and rents, as well as the availability of all types of housing. Subdivision regularly occurs in the outer areas of Melbourne, with numerous developers offering house and land packages. However, after 10 years[when?] of planning policies to encourage <a3_0>medium-density and high-density<a3_0/> development in existing areas with greater access to public transport and other services, Melbourne's <a2_0>middle and outer-ring<a2_0/> suburbs have seen significant brownfields redevelopment.
